content.DOC_APTCLIENT_ADD_REPO: [Parameters] [1] string repository_address [2] [opt] int port [Description] Add the repository address in the /etc/apt/sources.txt file
content.DOC_APTCLIENT_INSTALL: [Parameters] [1] string package_name [2][opt] string install_path [Description] Install the program or library from a remote repository listed in /etc/apt/sources.txt. Unless a path is specified, the program installs in /lib if it is a library or in /bin otherwise
content.DOC_APTCLIENT_UPDATE: [Parameters] None [Description] Update the list of available packages after adding a new repository in /etc/apt/sources.txt, or if the remote repository has updated its information in /server/conf/repod.conf
content.DOC_APTCLIENT_SEARCH: [Parameters] [1] string package_name [Description] Search specifically for the package in any of the repositories listed in /etc/apt/sources.txt
content.DOC_APTCLIENT_SHOW: [Parameters] [1] string repository_name [Description] Shows all packages available in the repository. The repository must be added in the /etc/apt/sources.txt file.
content.DOC_APTCLIENT_CHECK_UPGRADE: [Parameters] [1] string file_path [Description] Check if there is a newer version of the file in the repository.
content.APT-GET_DETAIL:
Install new programs hosted in remote repositories and manage updates to any installed programs from these repositories.
You can update the Operating System libraries by keeping the <color=#33cccc>official_server</color> option to <color=orange>true</color> from the <color=yellow>/etc/apt/<color=yellow>sources.txt</color></color> file.

After modifying the <color=yellow>sources.txt</color> file, launch <color=#0FABFFFF>apt-get update</color> so that the cache information is updated with the available packages.
content.LIBRSHELL_DETAIL: Library used in the reverse shell service. It is automatically included with the service installer.
content.EXPLOITREPORT_DETAIL: Tool to report vulnerabilities in system libraries.
content.FILE_LORE_08: Transcript Meeting N38. Board of Directors - Neurobox. Thursday 10/10/1996. Andrew: Good morning to all, I know this meeting was not planned... Richard: Can not we have solved this on the phone? Andrew: I'm afraid no, the security of the operating system has been vulnerated. Joana: I thought that could not happen. Andrew: No system is invulnerable but we did not think that they were going to get it so fast Richard: Is it known publicly? Andrew: Not yet, we are trying to negotiate with the exploit author so that he does not publish it, but we do not know how long we can buy his silence. In any case we are only gaining time, if a person has achieved, others will achieve it too. Joana: A lot of money has been invested to develop the system, and in the end it is violated as any other? Are we sure there have been no leaks from an employee? Andrew: We are investigating it, but it can take some time. Richard: Now it does not matter, as soon as it goes to light, it will suppose a decrease in the number of users, and the number of users is not growing as planned. Joana: Well, give away the system for free. Andrew: How free? Joana: The important thing here is the number of users, Ellipse was not created to earn money, we do not have problems of funds, do not lose perspective gentlemen. Andrew: The idea of selling it is to give a vision of quality and reliable product, people give more value to something that has bought than if they have given it to it Richard: Well, that's a somewhat daring affirmation, Linux is free and its number of users is not much less than in Ellipse. Joana: Exactly, also that difference of users is because Ellipse promises security and ease of use. I say that we continue gaining time and make sure that people identify Ellipse as a reliable system during all the time we can. We can always make a damage control at the time. Andrew: I think it's fine, all agree? Richard: I'll take care of talking to the Marketing Department. Andrew: Okay, let us know when you have something. I think we can conclude the meeting.
content.DOC_LIBMAIL_LOGIN: [Parameters] None [Description] Access the email account and returns a MetaMail type object if the login has been correct. In case of error, it returns a string
content.DOC_METAMAIL_FETCH: [Parameters] None [Description] Returns a string type list of the received emails, with a content preview. In case of error, it returns a string
content.DOC_METAMAIL_READ: [Parameters] [1] string mail_ID [Description] Read the full mail. The mail_ID argument can be obtained with fetch
content.DOC_METAMAIL_SEND: [Parameters] [1] string address [2] string subject [3] string message [Description] Send a new mail to the indicated recipient. Returns true if the mail has been sent correctly, otherwise returns a string with the error.
content.DOC_METAMAIL_DELETE: [Parameters] [1] string mail_ID [Description] Delete the mail that corresponds with mail_ID. Returns true if it was removed successfully or a string with the error message.
content.DOC_APTCLIENT_DEL_REPO: [Parameters] [1] string repository_address [Description] Remove the repository address in the /etc/apt/sources.txt file
